page.title: 01Bilston and its surroundings
page.content: Now part of Wolverhampton, Bilston was for many centuries an important iron and steel making area. It is now struggling to recover from the closing of its major employers, the steelworks, and its associated industries. Because of high unemployment many shops have closed though the market is still a busy one. The main shopping area extends along one street which also contains Bilston's two oldest buildings, St. Leonard's Church and the Greyhound and Punchbowl Inn. Close to the town centre is Hickman Park, a popular and attractive place, with its flower beds, shrubs,trees and grassy playing areas. It is also the site of the annual carnival. The remainder of the area surveyed consists both of old Industrial villages and farmlands all now merged by industrial and urban development.
